XMLDB.COMMENT: XMLDB file for core Moodle tables

TABLE.NAME: config
TABLE.COMMENT: Moodle configuration variables

TABLE.NAME: config_plugins
TABLE.COMMENT: Moodle modules and plugins configuration variables

TABLE.NAME: course
TABLE.COMMENT: Central course table

FIELD.NAME: defaultgroupingid
FIELD.COMMENT: default grouping used in course modules, does not have key intentionally

FIELD.NAME: defaultrole
FIELD.COMMENT: The default role given to participants who self-enrol

TABLE.NAME: course_categories
TABLE.COMMENT: Course categories

FIELD.NAME: theme
FIELD.COMMENT: Theme for the category

KEY.NAME: parent
KEY.COMMENT: note that to make this recursive FK working someday, the parent field must be declared NULL

TABLE.NAME: course_display
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores info about how to display the course

TABLE.NAME: course_meta
TABLE.COMMENT: to store meta-courses relations

TABLE.NAME: course_modules
TABLE.COMMENT: course_modules table retrofitted from MySQL

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: customizable idnumber

FIELD.NAME: groupmembersonly
FIELD.COMMENT: only members of any group are allowed to access the activity

INDEX.NAME: idnumber-course
INDEX.COMMENT: non unique index (although programatically we are guarantying some sort of uniqueness both under this table and the grade_items one). TODO: We need a central store of module idnumbers in the future.

TABLE.NAME: course_sections
TABLE.COMMENT: to define the sections for each course

TABLE.NAME: course_request
TABLE.COMMENT: course requests

TABLE.NAME: course_allowed_modules
TABLE.COMMENT: allowed modules foreach course

TABLE.NAME: event
TABLE.COMMENT: For everything with a time associated to it

TABLE.NAME: cache_filters
TABLE.COMMENT: For keeping information about cached data

TABLE.NAME: cache_text
TABLE.COMMENT: For storing temporary copies of processed texts

INDEX.NAME: timemodified
INDEX.COMMENT: Mainly to help deletion of expired records from cron

TABLE.NAME: log
TABLE.COMMENT: Every action is logged as far as possible

TABLE.NAME: log_display
TABLE.COMMENT: For a particular module/action, specifies a moodle table/field

TABLE.NAME: message
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores all unread messages

TABLE.NAME: message_read
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores all messages that have been read

TABLE.NAME: message_contacts
TABLE.COMMENT: Maintains lists of relationships between users

TABLE.NAME: modules
TABLE.COMMENT: modules available in the site

TABLE.NAME: sessions2
TABLE.COMMENT: Optional database session storage in new format, not used by default

TABLE.NAME: adodb_logsql
TABLE.COMMENT: to save some logs from ADOdb

TABLE.NAME: timezone
TABLE.COMMENT: Rules for calculating local wall clock time for users

TABLE.NAME: user
TABLE.COMMENT: One record for each person

FIELD.NAME: imagealt
FIELD.COMMENT: alt tag for user uploaded image

FIELD.NAME: screenreader
FIELD.COMMENT: flag for determining whehter the user uses a screenreader.

TABLE.NAME: user_preferences
TABLE.COMMENT: Allows modules to store arbitrary user preferences

TABLE.NAME: user_lastaccess
TABLE.COMMENT: To keep track of course page access times, used in online participants block, and participants list

TABLE.NAME: scale
TABLE.COMMENT: Defines grading scales

TABLE.NAME: scale_history
TABLE.COMMENT: History table

FIELD.NAME: action
FIELD.COMMENT: created/modified/deleted constants

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: What caused the modification? manual/module/import/...

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

FIELD.NAME: loggeduser
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

TABLE.NAME: stats_daily
TABLE.COMMENT: to accumulate daily stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

FIELD.NAME: stattype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of stat

FIELD.NAME: stat1
FIELD.COMMENT: stat1. usually used for reads

FIELD.NAME: stat2
FIELD.COMMENT: stat2. usually used for writes.

TABLE.NAME: stats_weekly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate weekly stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

FIELD.NAME: stattype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of stat

FIELD.NAME: stat1
FIELD.COMMENT: stat1. usually used for reads

FIELD.NAME: stat2
FIELD.COMMENT: stat2. usually used for writes.

TABLE.NAME: stats_monthly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate monthly stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

FIELD.NAME: stattype
FIELD.COMMENT: type of stat

FIELD.NAME: stat1
FIELD.COMMENT: stat1. usually used for reads

FIELD.NAME: stat2
FIELD.COMMENT: stat2. usually used for writes.

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_daily
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate daily stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_weekly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate weekly stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_monthly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate monthly stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: post
TABLE.COMMENT: Generic post table to hold data blog entries etc in different modules

TABLE.NAME: role
TABLE.COMMENT: moodle roles

TABLE.NAME: context
TABLE.COMMENT: one of these must be set

TABLE.NAME: context_temp
TABLE.COMMENT: Used by build_context_path() in upgrade and cron to keep context depths and paths in sync.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: This id isn't autonumeric/sequence. It's the context->id

TABLE.NAME: capabilities
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines all capabilities

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_assign
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines what role can assign what role

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_override
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines what role can override what role

TABLE.NAME: role_assignments
TABLE.COMMENT: assigning roles to different context

TABLE.NAME: role_capabilities
TABLE.COMMENT: permission has to be signed, overriding a capability for a particular role in a particular context

TABLE.NAME: role_names
TABLE.COMMENT: role names in native strings

TABLE.NAME: role_sortorder
TABLE.COMMENT: sort order of course managers in a course

TABLE.NAME: user_info_field
TABLE.COMMENT: Customisable user profile fields

FIELD.NAME: shortname
FIELD.COMMENT: short name for each field

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: field name

FIELD.NAME: datatype
FIELD.COMMENT: Type of data held in this field

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: Description of field

FIELD.NAME: categoryid
FIELD.COMMENT: id from category table

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: order within the category

FIELD.NAME: required
FIELD.COMMENT: Field required

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: Field locked

FIELD.NAME: visible
FIELD.COMMENT: Visibility: private, public, hidden

FIELD.NAME: forceunique
FIELD.COMMENT: should the field contain unique data

FIELD.NAME: signup
FIELD.COMMENT: display field on signup page

FIELD.NAME: defaultdata
FIELD.COMMENT: Default value for this field

FIELD.NAME: param1
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param2
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param3
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param4
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

FIELD.NAME: param5
FIELD.COMMENT: General parameter field

TABLE.NAME: user_info_category
TABLE.COMMENT: Customisable fields categories

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Category name

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Display order

TABLE.NAME: user_info_data
TABLE.COMMENT: Data for the customisable user fields

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: id from the user table

FIELD.NAME: fieldid
FIELD.COMMENT: id from the field table

FIELD.NAME: data
FIELD.COMMENT: Field data

TABLE.NAME: mnet_enrol_course
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about courses on remote hosts

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique remote-course ID

FIELD.NAME: remoteid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID of course on its home server

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_course table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_enrol_assignments
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about enrolments on courses on remote hosts

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique enrollment ID

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID of user on *this* server

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID of course on its home server

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_enrol_assignments table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_application
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about applications on remote hosts

TABLE.NAME: mnet_host
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about the local and remote hosts for RPC

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Host ID

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_host table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_host2service
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about the services for a given host

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_host2service table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_log
TABLE.COMMENT: Store session data from users migrating to other sites

FIELD.NAME: hostid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique host ID

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_log table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_rpc
TABLE.COMMENT: Functions or methods that we may publish or subscribe to

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Function ID

FIELD.NAME: profile
FIELD.COMMENT: Method signature

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_rpc table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_service
TABLE.COMMENT: A service is a group of functions

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Service ID

FIELD.NAME: offer
FIELD.COMMENT: Do we even offer this service?

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_service table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_service2rpc
TABLE.COMMENT: Group functions or methods under a service

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Required ID field

FIELD.NAME: serviceid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique service ID

FIELD.NAME: rpcid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique Function ID

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_service2rpc table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_session
TABLE.COMMENT: Store session data from users migrating to other sites

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Required ID field

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique user ID

FIELD.NAME: username
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique username

FIELD.NAME: token
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique SHA1 Token

FIELD.NAME: mnethostid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique remote host ID

FIELD.NAME: useragent
FIELD.COMMENT: SHA1 hash of User Agent

FIELD.NAME: confirm_timeout
FIELD.COMMENT: UNIX timestamp for expiry of session

FIELD.NAME: session_id
FIELD.COMMENT: The PHP Session ID

FIELD.NAME: expires
FIELD.COMMENT: Expire time of session on peer

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_session table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_sso_access_control
TABLE.COMMENT: Users by host permitted (or not) to login from a remote provider

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: Required ID field

FIELD.NAME: mnet_host_id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of mnet host

FIELD.NAME: accessctrl
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether or not this user/host can login

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_sso_access_control table

TABLE.NAME: events_queue
TABLE.COMMENT: This table is for storing queued events. It stores only one copy of the eventdata here, and entries from this table are being references by the event_queue_handlers table.

FIELD.NAME: eventdata
FIELD.COMMENT: serialized version of the data object passed to the event handler.

FIELD.NAME: stackdump
FIELD.COMMENT: serialized debug_backtrace showing where the event was fired from

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: $USER->id when the event was fired

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: time stamp of the first time this was added

TABLE.NAME: events_handlers
TABLE.COMMENT: This table is for storing which components requests what type of event, and the location of the responsible handlers. For example, the assignment registers 'grade_updated' event with a function assignment_grade_handler() that should be called event time an 'grade_updated' event is triggered by grade_update() function.

FIELD.NAME: eventname
FIELD.COMMENT: name of the event, e.g. 'grade_updated'

FIELD.NAME: handlermodule
FIELD.COMMENT: e.g. moodle, mod/forum, block/rss_client

FIELD.NAME: handlerfile
FIELD.COMMENT: path to the file of the function, eg /grade/export/lib.php

FIELD.NAME: handlerfunction
FIELD.COMMENT: serialized string or array describing function, suitable to be passed to call_user_func()

FIELD.NAME: schedule
FIELD.COMMENT: 'cron' or 'instant'.

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: number of failed attempts to process this handler

TABLE.NAME: events_queue_handlers
TABLE.COMMENT: This is the list of queued handlers for processing. The event object is retrieved from the events_queue table. When no further reference is made to the event_queues table, the corresponding entry in the events_queue table should be deleted. Entry should get deleted after a successful event processing by the specified handler.

FIELD.NAME: queuedeventid
FIELD.COMMENT: foreign key id corresponding to the id of the event_queues table

FIELD.NAME: handlerid
FIELD.COMMENT: foreign key id corresponding to the id of the event_handlers table

FIELD.NAME: status
FIELD.COMMENT: number of failed attempts to process this handler

FIELD.NAME: errormessage
FIELD.COMMENT: if an error happened last time we tried to process this event, record it here.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: time stamp of the last attempt to run this from the queue

TABLE.NAME: grade_outcomes
TABLE.COMMENT: This table describes the outcomes used in the system. An outcome is a statement tied to a rubric scale from low to high, such as Not met, Borderline, Met (stored as 0,1 or 2)

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Mostly these are defined site wide ie NULL

FIELD.NAME: shortname
FIELD.COMMENT: The short name or code for this outcome statement

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: The full description of the outcome (usually 1 sentence)

FIELD.NAME: scaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: The recommended scale for this outcome.

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: outcome description

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this outcome was first created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this outcome was last updated

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

TABLE.NAME: grade_outcomes_courses
TABLE.COMMENT: stores what outcomes are used in what courses.

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the course

FIELD.NAME: outcomeid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the outcome

TABLE.NAME: grade_categories
TABLE.COMMENT: This table keeps information about categories, used for grouping items.

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The course this grade category is part of

FIELD.NAME: parent
FIELD.COMMENT: Categories can be hierarchical

FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.COMMENT: How many parents does this category have?

FIELD.NAME: path
FIELD.COMMENT: shows the path as /1/2/3 (like course_categories)

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this grade category

FIELD.NAME: aggregation
FIELD.COMMENT: A constant pointing to one of the predefined aggregation strategies (none, mean,median,sum, etc)

FIELD.NAME: keephigh
FIELD.COMMENT: Keep only the X highest items

FIELD.NAME: droplow
FIELD.COMMENT: Drop the X lowest items

FIELD.NAME: aggregateonlygraded
FIELD.COMMENT: aggregate only graded activities

FIELD.NAME: aggregateoutcomes
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregate outcomes

FIELD.NAME: aggregatesubcats
FIELD.COMMENT: ignore subcategories in aggregation

TABLE.NAME: grade_items
TABLE.COMMENT: This table keeps information about gradeable items (ie columns). If an activity (eg an assignment or quiz) has multiple grade_items associated with it (eg several outcomes or numerical grades), then there will be a corresponding multiple number of rows in this table.

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The course this item is part of

FIELD.NAME: categoryid
FIELD.COMMENT: (optional) the category group this item belongs to

FIELD.NAME: itemname
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this item (pushed in by the module)

FIELD.NAME: itemtype
FIELD.COMMENT: 'mod', 'blocks', 'import', 'calculated' etc

FIELD.NAME: itemmodule
FIELD.COMMENT: 'forum', 'quiz', 'csv', etc

FIELD.NAME: iteminstance
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the item module

FIELD.NAME: itemnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Can be used to distinguish multiple grades for an activity

FIELD.NAME: iteminfo
FIELD.COMMENT: Info and notes about this item XXX

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Arbitrary idnumber provided by the module responsible

FIELD.NAME: calculation
FIELD.COMMENT: Formula describing how to derive this grade from other items, referring to them using giXXX where XXX is grade item id ... eg something like: =sin(square([#gi20#])) + [#gi30#]

FIELD.NAME: gradetype
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = none, 1 = value, 2 = scale, 3 = text

FIELD.NAME: grademax
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the maximum allowable grade?

FIELD.NAME: grademin
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the minimum allowable grade?

FIELD.NAME: scaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is based on a scale, which one is it?

FIELD.NAME: outcomeid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is related to an outcome, which one is it?

FIELD.NAME: gradepass
FIELD.COMMENT: What grade is needed to pass? grademin < gradepass <= grademax

FIELD.NAME: multfactor
FIELD.COMMENT: Multiply all grades by this

FIELD.NAME: plusfactor
FIELD.COMMENT: Add this to all grades

FIELD.NAME: aggregationcoef
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregation coefficient used for category weights or other aggregation types

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Sorting order of the columns

FIELD.NAME: display
FIELD.COMMENT: Display as real grades, percentages (in reference to the minimum and maximum grades) or letters (A, B, C etc..), or course default (0)

FIELD.NAME: decimals
FIELD.COMMENT: Also known as precision, the number of digits after the decimal point symbol.

FIELD.NAME: hidden
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 is hidden, > 1 is a date to hide until (prevents viewing)

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 is locked, > 1 is a date to lock until (prevents update)

FIELD.NAME: locktime
FIELD.COMMENT: lock all final grades after this date

FIELD.NAME: needsupdate
FIELD.COMMENT: If this flag is set, then the whole column will be recalculated

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The first time this grade_item was created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

INDEX.NAME: idnumber-courseid
INDEX.COMMENT: non unique index (although programatically we are guarantying some sort of uniqueness both under this table and the course_modules one). TODO: We need a central store of module idnumbers in the future.

TABLE.NAME: grade_grades
TABLE.COMMENT: grade_grades This table keeps individual grades for each user and each item, exactly as imported or submitted by modules. The rawgrademax/min and rawscaleid are stored here to record the values at the time the grade was stored, because teachers might change this for an activity! All the results are normalised/resampled for the final grade value.

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: The item this grade belongs to

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who this grade is for

FIELD.NAME: rawgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: If the grade is a float value (or has been converted to one)

FIELD.NAME: rawgrademax
FIELD.COMMENT: The maximum allowable grade when this was created

FIELD.NAME: rawgrademin
FIELD.COMMENT: The minimum allowable grade when this was created

FIELD.NAME: rawscaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is based on a scale, which one was it?

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this grade

FIELD.NAME: finalgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: The final grade (cached) after all calculations are made

FIELD.NAME: hidden
FIELD.COMMENT: show 0, hide 1 or hide until date

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: not locked 0, locked from date

FIELD.NAME: locktime
FIELD.COMMENT: automatic locking of final grade, 0 means none, date otherwise

FIELD.NAME: exported
FIELD.COMMENT: date of last grade export, 0 if none

FIELD.NAME: overridden
FIELD.COMMENT: indicates grade overridden from gradebook, 0 means none, date means overridden

FIELD.NAME: excluded
FIELD.COMMENT: grade excluded from aggregation functions, date means when excluded

FIELD.NAME: feedback
FIELD.COMMENT: grading feedback

FIELD.NAME: feedbackformat
FIELD.COMMENT: format of feedback text

FIELD.NAME: information
FIELD.COMMENT: optiona information

FIELD.NAME: informationformat
FIELD.COMMENT: format of information text

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this grade was first created

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the time this grade was last modified

KEY.NAME: userid-itemid
KEY.COMMENT: one entry per user per item

TABLE.NAME: grade_outcomes_history
TABLE.COMMENT: History table

FIELD.NAME: action
FIELD.COMMENT: created/modified/deleted constants

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: What caused the modification? manual/module/import/...

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

FIELD.NAME: loggeduser
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Mostly these are defined site wide ie NULL

FIELD.NAME: shortname
FIELD.COMMENT: The short name or code for this outcome statement

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: The full description of the outcome (usually 1 sentence)

FIELD.NAME: scaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: The recommended scale for this outcome.

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: Outcome description

TABLE.NAME: grade_categories_history
TABLE.COMMENT: History of grade_categories

FIELD.NAME: action
FIELD.COMMENT: created/modified/deleted constants

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: What caused the modification? manual/module/import/...

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

FIELD.NAME: loggeduser
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The course this grade category is part of

FIELD.NAME: parent
FIELD.COMMENT: Categories can be hierarchical

FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.COMMENT: How many parents does this category have?

FIELD.NAME: path
FIELD.COMMENT: shows the path as /1/2/3 (like course_categories)

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this grade category

FIELD.NAME: aggregation
FIELD.COMMENT: A constant pointing to one of the predefined aggregation strategies (none, mean,median,sum, etc)

FIELD.NAME: keephigh
FIELD.COMMENT: Keep only the X highest items

FIELD.NAME: droplow
FIELD.COMMENT: Drop the X lowest items

FIELD.NAME: aggregateonlygraded
FIELD.COMMENT: aggregate only graded items

FIELD.NAME: aggregateoutcomes
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregate outcomes

FIELD.NAME: aggregatesubcats
FIELD.COMMENT: ignore subcategories in aggregation

TABLE.NAME: grade_items_history
TABLE.COMMENT: History of grade_items

FIELD.NAME: action
FIELD.COMMENT: created/modified/deleted constants

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: What caused the modification? manual/module/import/...

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

FIELD.NAME: loggeduser
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: The course this item is part of

FIELD.NAME: categoryid
FIELD.COMMENT: (optional) the category group this item belongs to

FIELD.NAME: itemname
FIELD.COMMENT: The name of this item (pushed in by the module)

FIELD.NAME: itemtype
FIELD.COMMENT: 'mod', 'blocks', 'import', 'calculated' etc

FIELD.NAME: itemmodule
FIELD.COMMENT: 'forum', 'quiz', 'csv', etc

FIELD.NAME: iteminstance
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the item module

FIELD.NAME: itemnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Can be used to distinguish multiple grades for an activity

FIELD.NAME: iteminfo
FIELD.COMMENT: Info and notes about this item XXX

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Arbitrary idnumber provided by the module responsible

FIELD.NAME: calculation
FIELD.COMMENT: Formula describing how to derive this grade from other items, referring to them using giXXX where XXX is grade item id ... eg something like: =sin(square([#gi20#])) + [#gi30#]

FIELD.NAME: gradetype
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 = none, 1 = value, 2 = scale, 3 = text

FIELD.NAME: grademax
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the maximum allowable grade?

FIELD.NAME: grademin
FIELD.COMMENT: What is the minimum allowable grade?

FIELD.NAME: scaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is based on a scale, which one is it?

FIELD.NAME: outcomeid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is related to an outcome, which one is it?

FIELD.NAME: gradepass
FIELD.COMMENT: What grade is needed to pass? grademin < gradepass <= grademax

FIELD.NAME: multfactor
FIELD.COMMENT: Multiply all grades by this

FIELD.NAME: plusfactor
FIELD.COMMENT: Add this to all grades

FIELD.NAME: aggregationcoef
FIELD.COMMENT: Aggregation coefficient used for category weights or other aggregation types

FIELD.NAME: sortorder
FIELD.COMMENT: Sorting order of the columns

FIELD.NAME: hidden
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 is hidden, > 1 is a date to hide until (prevents viewing)

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: 1 is locked, > 1 is a date to lock until (prevents update)

FIELD.NAME: locktime
FIELD.COMMENT: lock all final grades after this date

FIELD.NAME: needsupdate
FIELD.COMMENT: If this flag is set, then the whole column will be recalculated

TABLE.NAME: grade_grades_history
TABLE.COMMENT: History table

FIELD.NAME: action
FIELD.COMMENT: created/modified/deleted constants

FIELD.NAME: source
FIELD.COMMENT: What caused the modification? manual/module/import/...

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: The last time this grade_item was modified

FIELD.NAME: loggeduser
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this outcome

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: The item this grade belongs to

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The user who this grade is for

FIELD.NAME: rawgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: If the grade is a float value (or has been converted to one)

FIELD.NAME: rawgrademax
FIELD.COMMENT: The maximum allowable grade when this was created

FIELD.NAME: rawgrademin
FIELD.COMMENT: The minimum allowable grade when this was created

FIELD.NAME: rawscaleid
FIELD.COMMENT: If this grade is based on a scale, which one was it?

FIELD.NAME: usermodified
FIELD.COMMENT: the userid of the person who last modified this grade

FIELD.NAME: finalgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: The final grade (cached) after all calculations are made

FIELD.NAME: hidden

FIELD.NAME: locked

FIELD.COMMENT: automatic locking of final grade, 0 means none, date otherwise

FIELD.NAME: exported

FIELD.NAME: overridden
FIELD.COMMENT: indicates grade overridden from gradebook, 0 means none, date means overridden

FIELD.NAME: excluded

FIELD.NAME: feedback
FIELD.COMMENT: grading feedback

FIELD.NAME: feedbackformat
FIELD.COMMENT: format of feedback text

FIELD.NAME: information
FIELD.COMMENT: optiona information

FIELD.NAME: informationformat
FIELD.COMMENT: format of information text

TABLE.NAME: grade_import_newitem
TABLE.COMMENT: temporary table for storing new grade_item names from grade import

FIELD.NAME: itemname
FIELD.COMMENT: new grade item name

FIELD.NAME: importcode
FIELD.COMMENT: import batch code for identification

FIELD.NAME: importer
FIELD.COMMENT: user importing the data

TABLE.NAME: grade_import_values
TABLE.COMMENT: Temporary table for importing grades

FIELD.NAME: itemid
FIELD.COMMENT: if set, this points to existing grade_items id

FIELD.NAME: newgradeitem
FIELD.COMMENT: if set, points to the id of grade_import_newitem

FIELD.NAME: finalgrade
FIELD.COMMENT: raw grade value

FIELD.NAME: importcode
FIELD.COMMENT: similar to backup_code, a unique batch code for identifying one batch of imports

TABLE.NAME: tag
TABLE.COMMENT: Tag table - this generic table will replace the old "tags" table.

FIELD.NAME: rawname
FIELD.COMMENT: The raw, unnormalised name for the tag as entered by users

FIELD.NAME: flag
FIELD.COMMENT: a tag can be 'flagged' as inappropriate

TABLE.NAME: tag_correlation
TABLE.COMMENT: The rationale for the 'tag_correlation' table is performance. It works as a cache for a potentially heavy load query done at the 'tag_instance' table. So, the 'tag_correlation' table stores redundant information derived from the 'tag_instance' table

TABLE.NAME: tag_instance
TABLE.COMMENT: tag_instance table holds the information of associations between tags and other items

FIELD.NAME: ordering
FIELD.COMMENT: Maintains the order of the tag instances of an item

TABLE.NAME: groups
TABLE.COMMENT: Each record represents a group.

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Short human readable unique name for the group.

TABLE.NAME: groupings
TABLE.COMMENT: A grouping is a collection of groups. WAS: groups_groupings

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Short human readable unique name for group.

FIELD.NAME: configdata
FIELD.COMMENT: extra configuration data - may be used by group IU tools

TABLE.NAME: groups_members
TABLE.COMMENT: Link a user to a group.

TABLE.NAME: groupings_groups
TABLE.COMMENT: Link a grouping to a group (note, groups can be in multiple groupings ONLY in a course). WAS: groups_groupings_groups

TABLE.NAME: user_private_key
TABLE.COMMENT: access keys used in cookieless scripts - rss, etc.

FIELD.NAME: script
FIELD.COMMENT: plugin, module - unique identifier

FIELD.NAME: value
FIELD.COMMENT: private access key value

FIELD.NAME: instance
FIELD.COMMENT: optional instance id

FIELD.NAME: iprestriction
FIELD.COMMENT: ip restriction

FIELD.NAME: validuntil
FIELD.COMMENT: timestampt - valid until data

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: created timestamp

TABLE.NAME: grade_letters
TABLE.COMMENT: Repository for grade letters, for courses and other moodle entities that use grades.

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: What contextid does this letter apply to (for now these will always be courses, but later...)

FIELD.NAME: lowerboundary
FIELD.COMMENT: The lower boundary of the letter. Its upper boundary is the lower boundary of the next highest letter, unless there is none above, in which case it's grademax for that grade_item.

FIELD.NAME: letter
FIELD.COMMENT: The display value of the letter. Can be any character or string of characters (OK, A, 10% etc..)

INDEX.NAME: contextid-lowerboundary
INDEX.COMMENT: index used when fetching context letters

TABLE.NAME: cache_flags
TABLE.COMMENT: Cache of time-sensitive flags

TABLE.NAME: grade_settings
TABLE.COMMENT: gradebook settings

TABLE.NAME: webdav_locks
TABLE.COMMENT: Resource locks for WebDAV users

STATEMENT.NAME: insert mnet_application
STATEMENT.COMMENT: Initial insert of records on table mnet_application

STATEMENT.NAME: insert log_display
STATEMENT.COMMENT: Initial insert of records on table log_display
